definition: stud (for decorating clothing, shoes, belts etc)
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]

sentences.english: He wanted to buy the saddle garnished with silver studs .
sentences.chinese: 他想买那付有银质饰钉的马鞍。

sentences.english: Golden brass corners and reinforced studded edges.
sentences.chinese: 金色黄铜包角，箱边以饰钉加固。

sentences.english: Rushing in is less dangerous in these studded leather boots.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中这些钉有饰钉的皮靴能够减少危险。

sentences.english: And under each eye, driven in, were 2 pins with glass heads.
sentences.chinese: 在她双眼下方，各有一个带玻璃头的饰钉穿进去。

definition: a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
variant of 表盤|表盘[biao3 pan2]/watch face
